type: Consultant services to perform a needs assessment and feasibility study
short_summary: Needs assessment and feasibility study for Vineland Station
description:
A consultant will perform a needs assessment and feasibility study which will compare the program requirements and goals with what is physically possible due to the building capability and spatially feasibility. The consultant shall gather sufficient information on the scientific program needs in order to understand AAFC functional and operational requirements and become familiar with the building and its ability to support the research. From the information gathering and analysis the consultant will outline if the research can be adequately performed at Vineland Station. The consultant will also highlight key components that can only be performed at the Vineland Station and those components which could relocate to another centre if required. Finally, if upgrades to Vineland Station are required to make the facility compliant with the functional and space needs the consultant shall outline the work required and estimate the associated costs.








fDue  to update the list of multicultural and Indigenous hotels in Nova Scotia, Cape Breton, then rate them.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Notice Title

Consultant Services for Needs Assessment and Feasibility Study

## Solicitation Number
01B46-22-129

## Procurement Category
SRV (Services)

## Notice Type
Request for Proposal (RFP)

## Tender Status
Expired

## Brief Description

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites proposal submissions for Consultant Services to perform a needs assessment and feasibility study. The purpose of this study is to compare the program requirements and goals with the physical capabilities of the building at Vineland Station, and to determine the feasibility of conducting research at this location. The consultant will gather information on the scientific program needs, analyze the functional and operational requirements of AAFC, and outline the key components that can be performed at Vineland Station. The study will also identify potential upgrades required to make the facility compliant with the functional and space needs.

## Tender Details

* Tender Closing Date: December 12, 2022, 14:00 EST
* Tender Period Notice URL: None
* Attachment URLs:
	+ [PDF Document 1](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/02/e751cdddec013d62e0f207de5b161eba/q_an_a.pdf)
	+ [PDF Document 2](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/08/c9bcfcd838760274280458767eb6738f/q_an_a2.pdf)
	+ [RFP Document](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/02/6c0269db5f11db95243ba0c7aa0704f1/rfp_final_22-129.pdf)

## Contact Information

For any inquiries related to this tender process, please contact:
Carol Rahal, Contracts Officer, Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada
Tel: 418-928-1059, Email: [carol.rahal@agr.gc.ca](mailto:carol.rahal@agr.gc.ca)

Note: I have removed the unnecessary and redundant information, rephrased the text to make it more concise and clear, and formatted the markdown to make it easy to read. I have also kept the original attachments URLs as they were in the original text.  Let me know if this helps! 400 words is a good constraint to keep
